Sweet Potato Casserole

Jump to Recipe

Sweet Potato Casserole is a beloved dish that combines the natural sweetness of sweet potatoes with a rich, creamy texture, making it a perfect side for any holiday meal or family gathering. This recipe not only highlights the vibrant flavors of sweet potatoes but also elevates them with the indulgent addition of brown sugar, buttery goodness, and crunchy pecans, topped with delightful mini marshmallows that caramelize beautifully in the oven. Whether you're looking to impress guests at Thanksgiving or simply enjoy a comforting dish at home, this Sweet Potato Casserole is sure to become a favorite in your recipe collection. With simple ingredients and easy-to-follow steps, you'll have a deliciously satisfying casserole that’s both nutritious and decadent, making it ideal for both special occasions and weeknight dinners. Dive into this delightful recipe and discover how to create a Sweet Potato Casserole that’s not only tasty but also a feast for the eyes!

Ingredients

sweet potatoes

Choose sweet potatoes that are firm and free of blemishes. For a creamier texture, you can steam them instead of boiling. If unavailable, you can substitute with butternut squash or pumpkin, but adjust the sweetness accordingly.

brown sugar

Light or dark brown sugar can be used interchangeably; dark brown will impart a deeper flavor. If you need a substitute, you can use white sugar mixed with a little molasses (1 cup white sugar + 1 tablespoon molasses for 1 cup brown sugar).

butter

Use unsalted butter for better control over the dish's saltiness. If you're looking for a dairy-free option, coconut oil or vegan butter can serve as effective substitutes.

milk

Whole milk will add richness, but you can use any milk (including almond, oat, or soy milk) for a dairy-free version. If you're out of milk, a mix of water and a bit of butter can also work.

eggs

Large eggs are standard; however, if you need an egg substitute (for vegan options), use 1/4 cup of applesauce or 1 tablespoon of ground flaxseed mixed with 2.5 tablespoons of water per egg.

vanilla extract

Always use pure vanilla extract for the best flavor; if you're in a pinch, imitation vanilla can work but may lack depth. You can also infuse the milk with vanilla pods for a more robust flavor.

salt

Salt enhances all flavors, but be cautious with added salt if using salted butter. For a flavor boost, consider using sea salt or Himalayan pink salt.

pecans

Toast the pecans lightly before adding them to enhance their flavor. If allergies are a concern, walnuts or almonds can be excellent substitutes.

mini marshmallows

For a more gourmet touch, consider using homemade marshmallows or even toasted coconut flakes as a topping. If avoiding marshmallows, you could use a layer of caramel sauce or a sprinkle of brown sugar instead.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Set your oven to 350°F (175°C). This temperature is perfect for baking the casserole evenly, ensuring that the sweet potatoes cook through while the topping gets that nice golden color.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Sweet Potatoes

    Peel and chop 4 medium sweet potatoes into uniform chunks. This helps them cook evenly. Boil the chunks in a pot of water for about 15-20 minutes, or until they are fork-tender. For faster cooking, you can cut them smaller.

  • Step 3: Mash the Sweet Potatoes

    Once the sweet potatoes are tender, drain them well and transfer them to a large mixing bowl. Use a potato masher or a fork to mash them until smooth. Aim for a creamy consistency with no lumps.

  • Step 4: Mix in Other Ingredients

    To the mashed sweet potatoes, add 1/2 cup of brown sugar, 1/4 cup of butter (softened), 1/3 cup of milk, 2 eggs, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Mix thoroughly until all ingredients are well combined and the mixture is creamy.

  • Step 5: Transfer to Baking Dish

    Grease a baking dish with butter or cooking spray to prevent the casserole from sticking. Pour the sweet potato mixture into the dish, spreading it out evenly.

  • Step 6: Prepare the Topping

    In a separate bowl, combine 1 cup of chopped pecans and 1 cup of mini marshmallows. This topping will add a crunchy and sweet contrast to the creamy sweet potato base. Mix them well.

  • Step 7: Add Topping and Bake

    Spread the pecan and marshmallow mixture evenly over the sweet potato layer. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the marshmallows are golden brown and the casserole is heated through. Keep an eye on the marshmallows to prevent burning.

  • Step 8: Cool and Serve

    Once baked, remove the casserole from the oven and let it cool slightly for about 10-15 minutes before serving. This allows the flavors to set and makes it easier to serve.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I peel sweet potatoes without wasting any flesh?

To peel sweet potatoes, use a vegetable peeler or a sharp knife. Start at one end and work your way around, applying gentle pressure to remove the skin. If you're new, try peeling them under running water to help reduce slipping.

What is the best way to chop sweet potatoes?

Cut sweet potatoes into even-sized chunks, about 1-2 inches. Start by cutting them in half lengthwise, then slice into half-moons or cubes. This ensures they cook evenly.

How can I tell if sweet potatoes are tender enough after boiling?

To check if they are tender, poke a chunk with a fork. If it goes through easily, they are ready. If not, give them a few more minutes.

What can I use if I don't have brown sugar?

You can substitute brown sugar with white sugar mixed with a bit of molasses. Use 1 cup of white sugar and add 1 tablespoon of molasses for a similar flavor.

Is it necessary to use eggs in the casserole?

Eggs help bind the sweet potato mixture and add richness. If you want to skip them, you can use a flaxseed meal mixture (1 tablespoon flaxseed meal + 2.5 tablespoons water) as a substitute.

How do I know when the casserole is done baking?

The casserole is done when it's heated through and the mini marshmallows on top are golden brown. You can also insert a toothpick in the center; if it comes out clean, it's ready.

What can I do if my marshmallows burn before the casserole is cooked?

If you notice the marshmallows browning too quickly, you can cover the casserole with aluminum foil to prevent burning while allowing the rest to bake through.

How can I make this dish ahead of time?

You can prepare the sweet potato mixture and store it in the fridge for up to 24 hours before baking. Just add the marshmallow and pecan topping right before baking.

What are some alternatives to pecans if I have allergies?

If you have nut allergies, you can skip the pecans altogether or use seeds like pumpkin or sunflower seeds for a similar crunch.

How should I store leftovers?

Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days. Reheat in the oven or microwave before serving.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For those with dietary restrictions, consider using coconut milk instead of regular milk for a dairy-free option. To make it vegan, substitute the eggs with flaxseed meal (1 tablespoon flaxseed meal mixed with 2.5 tablespoons water per egg), use vegan butter, and replace mini marshmallows with vegan marshmallows. Ensure the brown sugar is free of bone char for a fully vegan dish.

Pairings

For a delightful pairing with Sweet Potato Casserole, consider serving it alongside roasted turkey or glazed ham for a classic Thanksgiving meal. The sweetness of the casserole complements the savory flavors of the meats beautifully. For beverages, opt for a light-bodied white wine like Sauvignon Blanc or a sparkling apple cider, which can enhance the dish's sweetness while cleansing the palate.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Sweet Potato Casserole warm in a rustic baking dish to create a cozy atmosphere. Garnish with a sprinkle of cinnamon or extra pecans on top for added texture and flavor. Accompany it with a side of cranberry sauce to add a tart contrast to the sweetness. For a more casual gathering, consider individual servings in ramekins for a charming presentation.

Sweet Potato Casserole

60 min
$10
250 kcal
Difficulty: 30%
Servings: 8

Allergens:

DairyNuts

Dietary Tags:

VegetarianGluten-Free

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Side DishDessert

Tags:

Comfort FoodHolidaySide Dish

Description

A creamy and sweet casserole topped with crunchy pecans, perfect for any holiday or family gathering!

Ingredients

  • sweet potatoes: 4 medium
  • brown sugar: 1/2 cup
  • butter: 1/4 cup
  • milk: 1/3 cup
  • eggs: 2
  • vanilla extract: 1 teaspoon
  • salt: 1/2 teaspoon
  • pecans: 1 cup
  • mini marshmallows: 1 cup

Date Created:

11/16/2024
